page.title: 10BUILTH (W): ECOLOGY
page.content: The land around Builth is fertile enough for woodland to grow naturally. The deciduous woodland includes ash, beech ,alder, silver birch, elm, oak and horse chestnut. There are also plantations where pine trees predominate.The forestry commission has planted these areas and the soft-wood can be used for building and for making furniture. There is a great variety of animals in the woodlands,in the trees themselves and in the thick undergrowth ;toads,foxes,grey squirrels,hedgehogs,blue tits and even the Great Spotted Woodpecker.There are lots of rookeries where crows build their nests and breed. The undergrowth is made up of bracken,brambles,young trees and different kinds of grasses.
